column4: Folks, I need urgent help. My maverick installed on usb stick stopped booting. I've backup image of the stick and saved it on new stick, the same thing happens. USB stick reboots PC just after the bios logo appears. I've booted another system and mounted the stick, all files are there. I suspect boot record is broken somehow. Can someone help me restore it. Corrupted stick is mounted in /mnt . How can I update grub, or at least how can I find out which gru
How you tried https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Grub2#Recover%20Grub%202%20via%20LiveCD ?
if any of the instructions are confusing, just ask
thx for the info, I already booted another ubuntu and mounter currputed stick
So start at the sudo mount --bind steps
so far so good, fingers crossed
Ok, good luck!
Dude, thank you so much for the link and mickster04 also. You guys are great!!! It works :)
Your welcome. I'm glad it worked.
it took 5 minutes to boot. How can I force fsck. It booted 30 seconds before.
It booted in 30 second before
Maybe it will boot better now that you have run a fsck?

I haven't run fsck, can't remember the command, it was something reboot -F something. This is my dmesg http://paste.ubuntu.com/512741/ it shows a lot of warnings which I don't quite understand. Thx for helping so far, it's really appreciated.
EXT4-fs (sda1): INFO: recovery required on readonly filesystem
Is mounted filesystem with ordered data mode good for USB stick, or it should be mounted differently.
I don't know alot about mounting and filesystems
ok mate, thx once again for the help :)
If I was to give you advice on running fsck, it would be from me reading man fsck.ext4

It looks like fsck.ext4 -f -p /dev/sda1 might be what you need. However, that would have to be while the filesystem is unmounted, so maybe from another system or somehow early in the boot? Of course, it might not still be /dev/sda1 if you are booted into another install/livecd
I've found out that shutdown -rF now will force fsck on reboot
however, even after running fsck boot time is still about 4 minutes comparing to 30seconds. It's seems that between this line:  EXT4-fs (sda1): mounted filesystem with ordered data mode. Opts: (null)
and the line: udev[435]: starting version 163 is gap of 3 minutes
Hmm, I don't have any clue why it's taking so long then. Hopefully someone else can help you
